intro: Andinia schizopogon, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandreed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Andinia schizopogon plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various desert wildlife.
